summary: Email chain between legal representatives and government regarding subpoenas served by the FBI on JPMorgan Chase in relation to an investigation, likely connected to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence discusses coordination of document production and subpoena service.

persons.name: Sahni, Anjan
persons.context: Appears to be a legal representative communicating about subpoenas served by the FBI on JPMorgan Chase and coordinating document production.

persons.name: Stoddart, Allison
persons.context: Attorney representing JPMorgan Chase, sending encrypted documents and correspondence regarding the FBI investigation.

connections.description: Communicating about FBI subpoenas and document production for JPMorgan Chase in an investigation.

events.title: FBI subpoena served on JPMorgan Chase
events.description: FBI served a subpoena on JPMorgan Chase related to an investigation, dated September 3, 2019.

events.title: Second FBI subpoena served
events.description: FBI served another subpoena on JPMorgan Chase dated October 8, 2019, after initial contact with legal representatives.

events.title: Document production from JPMorgan Chase
events.description: Allison Stoddart sent an encrypted zip file containing documents on behalf of JPMorgan Chase to government representatives.

keyFacts: The FBI served at least two subpoenas on JPMorgan Chase in September and October 2019 as part of an investigation.
Legal representatives from WilmerHale were coordinating document production and subpoena responses for JPMorgan Chase.
The correspondence indicates coordination issues, with the FBI serving subpoenas directly to JPMorgan after initial contact with legal counsel.
Encrypted documents were transmitted by JPMorgan Chase's legal team to government representatives in September 2019.
